summary: Teatro Stage Engine profile composed from core, physics, rendering, input, assets, audio, and scripting specs.

scenarios.description: A dynamic ball above a static stage floor must fall under gravity, bounce at least once with a realistic rebound, and then settle near the floor instead of falling into the abyss or exploding numerically.
apiNotes: bullet-physics.stepWorld (multiple small dt steps to observe bounces and decay)
bullet-physics.listContacts to verify a floor contact exists during impacts

scenarios.description: The Teatro puppet rig, when seeded with default pose and gravity, should remain within the stage room bounds with feet resting near the floor plane over a long run.
apiNotes: bullet-physics.stepWorld or TPWorld.step to advance physics
teatro-rendering.buildFrame or snapshot schema to inspect puppet pose

notes: This profile treats TeatroStageEngine as a concrete instance of the generic Teatro Game Engine. Behavioural semantics remain owned by the referenced specs and the TeatroPhysics reference implementation.
